text: as far as I know every time we've ever
made a machine somebody's died because
of that machine a forklift people die a
tractor people die an automobile people
die our machines have been killing us
ever since we've ever had machines so if
we make a robot and we end up dying
because of a robot should I be surprised
should any of us be surprised no if I
happen to create an AI humanoid and I
created it and one day it wants to turn
on me okay I can just shoot it okay I'll
just unplug it I'll rewire it I'd built
the thing I can unbuild the same okay so
I'm really not worried or maybe I'm a
military person then I want to send a
robot in well I already know how to kill
you I have missiles
I have tanks I have nuclear weapons so
you're gonna fear the robot and not the
missile I think it's misplaced concern
in our society by the way we've already
made smart robots we made robots that
beat us at chess there's a program
called deep blue no it wasn't walking
with arms and legs it doesn't have to we
invented chess and then we invent a
machine that's better at as a chess did
all society crumble after that No
so what's interesting to me is we will
use AI as we have been to specifically
target tasks that we need or want done
in place of ourselves
that's how AI will ultimately unfold
[Music]
